title: Gravity force - two satellites in different orbits

content.question: Two satellites orbit Earth at different altitudes. Satellite <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and orbits at a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from Earth’s center. Satellite <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> and orbits at a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> from Earth’s center. What is the ratio of the gravitational force exerted by Earth on Satellite <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to the gravitational force exerted by Earth on Satellite <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
